intro: Scleranthus × warnstorfii, commonly known as the hybrid meadow sandwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are linear and often covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Scleranthus × warnstorfii is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local biodiversity.
